alert.note: Alert for Henry; Jefferson; Lee; Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 17 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Henry, northern Van Buren, southern Jefferson and northwestern Lee Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1129 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Libertyville, or 7 miles southwest of Fairfield, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Birmingham around 1140 PM CDT. Fairfield around 1145 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Stockport, Lockridge, Hillsboro, Rome and Salem. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
